meanings.definition: To cover or clad (something) again with a different material.
meanings.sent1: The old house was recladded with shiny new siding.
meanings.sent2: The workers recladded the roof with durable metal sheets.
meanings.sent3: The recladded shed looked like it was wearing a fancy new coat.
meanings.sent4: The recladded walls breathed fresh life into the building.
meanings.sent5: The process of recladding the structure made it look brand new.

meanings.definition: To provide a new outer layer or covering for (a building or structure).
meanings.sent1: They recladded the office building to make it more modern.
meanings.sent2: The school was recladded to improve its insulation.
meanings.sent3: The recladded facade of the building surprised everyone with its beauty.
meanings.sent4: The recladded exterior shielded the building from the harsh weather.
meanings.sent5: The newly recladded structure stood out in the neighborhood.
